701983f-a.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park - Van Cortlandt Mansion.
701983f-a.text:
VAN C.RuuuiNDI RNSI0N Van Cortlandt Tark, Sronx. Dult in 1784
by Prederick Van Cortlandt, this beorgian mansion was
visited by General ashington during the Eevolutionary
ar. Ihe anple stone house has an unpretentious exterior
that contrasts strongly with the rich 6eorgian interor.
The estate was held continuously by the Van Cortlandt
family until 1858, when it was purchased by the city for
a park.
Bank ofNew York Calendar 1957-68

701985f-b.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park.
701985f-b.text:
Van Cortlandt Park (Bronx) The Van Cortlandt
House Museum, the former residence of the Van Cortlandts,
built in 1748 and now maintained by the Colonial Dames.
The estate was purchased by the City of New York to be
used as a park in 1889.
1981
Gift of Randall Comfort
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE
(2)
Another view of the Van Cortlandt House.
About, 1900
MAY BE REPRODUCED

701982f.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park - Van Cortlandt Vault.
701982f.text:
Van Cortlandt Park (Bronx): Shown is the Van
Cortlandt vault, for generations the burial place of the
Van Cortlandts, on the heights known as Vault Hill, to
the northeast of the Van Cortlandt Mansion.
About 1891
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE R PRODUCED

701966f-a.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park.
701966f-a.text:
Van Cortlandt Park (Bronx): Viewing west across
the lower end of Van Cortland Lake as it is being filled.
On the left is the 242nd Street I.R.T. subway station,
on Broadway; on the right is the Horace Mann High School,
on West 216th Street.
About 1917
MAY BE REPROTUCED

701977f-a.title: Bronx: Van Cortlandt Park - cairn of stones on Indian Field.
701977f-a.text:
Van Cortlandt Park: A view of the cairn of stones on Indian Field.
The cairn is situated on the west side of Van Cortlandt Park East, at the
head of West 237th Street and is dedicated to the Stockbridge Indians.
The inscription of the tablet reads:
Augmst 31, 1778.
Upon this field
Chief Nimham
And seventeen Stockbridge Indians
As Allies of the Patriots,
Gave their lives for Liberty.
Erected by Bronx Chapter,
Daumhters of the American Revolution
Mount Vernon, N.Y.
June 14, 1906.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
1906.
701977f-a.folder: Van Cortlandt Park & cairn of stones on Indian Field., Bronx, NY
